intro: Platyschkuhria desertorum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelion blooms. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and lobed leaves adapted to conserve water. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Platyschkuhria desertorum is well-suited to harsh desert environments, making it an important component of local flora.
